intro: Phyllanthus phuquocensis, commonly known as Phu Quoc star gooseberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the island of Phu Quoc in the South China Sea, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-green berries that are clustered together. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a slightly rough texture. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
